commentThread.commentText: People just hater on you lat theme hate

I am exceedingly happy to nice to old people; the disabled and kids. At one point in my life, I was young an d disabled and I will be old; thus needing someone's generosity but plan and simple kindness. If you do a good thing then surely it will come back to you. Most importantly, we should have good humanity towards all living creatures. However if it is not in you to give then God will take care of it, one way or another. The references to the brother in a negative way is just not nice nor fair on the basis that he is trying hard to be a beacon of higher self for our race of people. If truth be told this is who we are since the beginning of time!!! I agree completely in what he is teaching and showing for all to see. Even if you still disagree, why can't be just try harder to make a positive difference to another human being?
I often see elderly folks helping in the checkout lines in Matamoros supermarkets and I never thought they were just there for the tips until now.

commentThread.commentText: Do you know how much the elderly make a normal/common day of tipping? They make between 300 pesos to 700 pesos A DAY!!!!! in a good store and that's a lot in the Mexican way of life!!! How do I know, I've got elderly friends who've told me such. AND WE ALL TIP THEM AT LEAST 5 PESOS FOR THEIR BAGGING! Gosh below that amount, we Mexican guys would say, would think: YOU'RE A SON OF A BITCH!+ But again Negrito it all depends on the neighbourhood of the store (location)!

Wow...when and if you come back to the U.S. you miss the Mexican way of life.. people going outside in the afternoons and interacting with neighbors...walking around...Unlike in the U.S. where everyone stays locked up inside their house...It took me a while to re-adjust to American life...I have neighbors that I havent even met...only seen some once in a blue moon.

Youre right i think older people worked in the mornings then the young elementary kids...yes "elementary" kids would bag groceries after school...they re not paid employees...they all work for tips that buyers give them.

Funny you should mention that...Mexico doesnt have a lot of social programs like the U.S. there is no social security check when you get old.. you will see older people bagging groceries, working a parking lot guards, yard service, house helpers, and selling small goods to make enough to get by...I remember that his one man used to ride his bike at night and blow a whistle as he did....turns out he was the "neighborhood watchman"...he does his bit at night then he goes around in the day and knocks on doors and asks for "donations"...from money to maybe food or whatever for his services...
Keep it up big dog, love seeing your vids. Really informative. Keep it up!
Looking forward to coming out there, putting the Passport to use. Thanks for sharing your experiences
Thank u brotha for sharing your experiences there

commentThread.commentText: Negrito Grande,It appears that people misinterpret your intellectual honesty about what you observe in Mexico. It's unfortunate some commenters resort to using foul language when they disagree. People can disagree without using four letter expletives. The fact remains in my view is that you provide a wealth of insightful cultural immersion information about Mexico to those who watch your videos. Gran trabajo.

commentThread.commentText: Mexico is great but there system is shit. the future is bleak over there for young people in a country where you make 3 dollars a day on average wtf you supposed do

replies.commentText: No, the minimum wage is way more than $3 dollars a day and the majority of Mexicans earn more than the minimum wage. Use google, get your information correct and then reply. There's a reason why the net migration of Mexicans to the USA is now negative...that's right..negative. The number of Mexicans returning to Mexico is now larger than the number of Mexicans migrating to the USA. Let me put it bluntly, you don't know what you're talking about.
+uzarate I can assure that the minimum wage a day is $3 to $5 (74 pesos)
Nigga fuckin stupid

+uzarate migration may be down but there still coming . there is literally shit work over there I don't need fucking Google to get my facts bro I can just observe what I see . some of my family members from Mexico that are my age are getting work visas to come work over here . people don't do shit over there especially in the ranchos, all people drink all day and a find a way to hustle . there is no money out here. and if there is it's limited to a few. there's no money out there bro.

I'm just going to say that I lived in Guadalajara Mexico for 10 years and I worked and made a living in Pesos. I have a BA with a double major in Latin American Studies and Political Science from the University of California Riverside and an MA in history from the University of Texas here in Texas so I know what I'm talking about. I willl now mute this post so I don't have to read anymore ignorance from idiots who have no idea what they're talking about.

@Andrew Malacara LOL...you can't even write English properly so I realize you don't like facts....thanks! I'm not your "bro" either. I don't socialize with ignorant pochos or dumbass ignorant immigrants.
